intro: Haworthia maughanii, commonly known as the Zulu bulb, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-shaped growth form. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically pale green with distinct white or translucent markings. Haworthia maughanii is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves to survive drought conditions. It is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
